Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the COVID-19 numbers in the United States by stating that they are better than almost all countries, which contradicts the fact that the United States has one of the highest death rates worldwide and a higher rate of infection than several other countries.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the United States has one of the highest death rates worldwide and a higher rate of infection than several other countries.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific data or evidence to back up the statement that the COVID-19 numbers in the United States are better than almost all countries.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the COVID-19 numbers in the United States are better than almost all countries without considering alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to the numbers.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations that contradict the claim, such as the higher death rate and infection rate in the United States compared to several other countries.
